fields.Title of Contribution: Colombian peace communities resist citizen security, while protective accompaniment subverts democratic security: Reflections on racialized security
fields.Description/Abstract: This article offers a racial analysis of security in Colombia. I describe the racist underpinnings of government ‘citizen security’ and ‘democratic security’ projects by highlighting a rural peace community’s cross ethnic solidarity network against militarization. I also analyze the racial and colonial dimensions of Colombian peace communities’ use of unarmed international accompaniers as protection from attacks. As such, resistance to insecurity is a window into complex processes of racialization, toward conceptual critiques of security and anti-racist security methodologies.
